image.altText: Three people with serious expressions in mathching shirts and jumpers walk down a footpath of a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Wary of being labelled a cult, this 'sovereign citizen' group has never spoken to mainstream media. It made an exception for Four Corners.

title.children: 'We're the authority': These 'sovereign citizen' sheriffs want to jail a PM

image.altText: Santos sign

props.synopsis: The battle for control of oil and gas giant Santos moved up a gear this week after Ryan Stokes, chairman of Beach Energy and son of billionaire Kerry, took a swipe at the Abu Dhabi government's tilt for a large slice of Australia's energy market.

title.children: The disturbing history behind the Santos suitor

image.altText: Vector illustration featuring robotic arms above two human figures working at conveyor belt lined with boxes.

props.synopsis: Experts share 23 bold, surprising and thought-provoking ideas to boost Australia's productivity growth — and improve living standards.

title.children: Big ideas to unlock Australia's prosperity puzzle

image.altText: Productivity Commission chair Danielle Wood stands in the ABC Ultimo newsroom.

props.synopsis: Government regulation has emerged as one of the key issues to be tackled at the government's economic reform round table this week, as business leaders and the Productivity Commission call for it to be curtailed.

title.children: 'Regulatory creep' dampening growth, productivity chief warns ahead of talks

image.altText: A close

props.synopsis: It comes more than four years after he left Hong Kong, where he faces criminal charges over his involvement in the 2019 pro-democracy protests.

title.children: Former pro-democracy Hong Kong activist granted asylum in Australia

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen listening to Donald Trump talk as they sit side-by-side at a media event.

props.synopsis: European leaders from Germany, France and Britain say they will accompany Volodymyr Zelenskyy to meet Donald Trump in Washington.

title.children: 'A steel porcupine': Europe sets expectations for White House meeting

image.altText: forest lodge shooting

props.synopsis: One man has died and another has been seriously injured in a shooting outside a hotel in Sydney's inner-city.

title.children: One man dead, another seriously injured in shooting outside Sydney pub

image.altText: Ali Quraishi

props.synopsis: Julian de Looze, a clinical director at Australia's biggest hospital, bought a strip club in Portland at the suggestion of a friend.  He did not know that friend was a serial rapist who used the venue to prey on women.

title.children: Rapist trusted by Aussie doctor to run US strip club jailed for 145 years

image.altText: A traditional Indian temple archway on a road with cars and walkers, seen alongside green forest trees

props.synopsis: The serenity of a sacred temple town in southern India has been broken by a police investigation into sinister and explosive whistleblower allegations about the secret killings and burials of hundreds of men, women and children over decades.

title.children: 'I buried hundreds': A temple town reckons with decades of alleged abuse

image.altText: Bailey Smith attempts to tackle Callum Mills

props.synopsis: Chris Scott unloads on the controversial Sydney Cricket Ground centre wicket area after seeing a number of players struggle to keep their feet in Geelong's 43-point win over Sydney.

title.children: 'Not conducive to AFL football': Geelong coach slams SCG playing surface

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin waves from behind a lectern

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin does not have the same goals as the other players in his game and the longer the various iterations of meetings and summits and phone calls go on, the more advantage he gains, writes Emily Clark.

title.children: There is one thing Russia respects, and Donald Trump just gave it all away

image.altText: Four Houthis holding up rifles and wearing scarves around their heads.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says the targeted attack was in response to repeated attacks by the Houthis against Israel.

title.children: Israel says it targeted energy site used by Houthis near Yemeni capital

image.altText: an aerial shot a light plane that crash landed on mona vale golf course

props.synopsis: An instructor pilot and student were on board the Piper Cherokee aircraft when it crash landed on the course at Mona Vale Golf Club.

title.children: Two people walk away after light plane crashes on Sydney golf course

image.altText: Tim Wilson speaks in parliament house.

props.synopsis: Tim Wilson has chided the government for failing to consult with the opposition before breaking with a long-held bipartisan position to recognise Palestinian statehood next month, suggesting aligning with the US.

title.children: Coalition MP says Australia should work with Trump on Palestinian recognition

image.altText: Zoe Besanko celebrates a goal with a St Kilda AFLW teammate.

props.synopsis: Zoe Besanko starts hot for St Kilda in an upset win over Adelaide, while Hawthorn gets some revenge for last season's AFLW finals loss to the Lions.

title.children: 'Ready to make their mark': Young stars shine as AFLW round one wraps up

image.altText: Bindi Irwin smiling in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: It took 13 years, 51 endometriosis lesions, a cyst, two surgeries and a hernia before she was able to start healing. Now Bindi Irwin wants to break the stigma surrounding women's health on a global scale.

title.children: The power and pain of Bindi Irwin's endometriosis journey

image.altText: Alex Lloyd leans his chin on his hand, resting on the top of his guitar.

props.synopsis: In 2001, Alex Lloyd broke through with his massive hit Amazing, a song that led to the best and then the worst time of his life. Now he's getting his life back on track.

title.children: The 'evil drug' and court case that almost broke Alex Lloyd

image.altText: Video still: Blurred image of young people sitting on a lounge chair

props.synopsis: A not-for-profit helping at-risk youth has been accused of possible corrupt conduct after a report revealed misuse of taxpayer funds.

title.children: Report uncovers alleged misuse of public money allotted to vulnerable kids

image.altText: A road witha few police cars on the side.

props.synopsis: The pair were hit by a vehicle on Green Road in Regents Park late on Sunday morning.

title.children: Four-year-old boy and man dead after being struck by a ute south of Brisbane

image.altText: A naked man and woman lean on a fence.

props.synopsis: When you think of nudism, you might picture postcard-perfect beaches or serene forests. But what about swathes of rugged Queensland bush, where the only neighbours are cattle herds and coal mines?

title.children: Thongs the only requirement at this bush weekender turned nudist haven

image.altText: An aerial shot of a rural housing sub-division at sunset

props.synopsis: Police say a 76-year-old tourist from South Australia suffered life-threatening injuries during a vehicle theft in the Kimberley region on Saturday.

title.children: Tourist run over as his car and caravan were stolen in WA's north

image.altText: A graphic of a sign reading 'Boss City' with a black and white mugshot of a man, with a gritty beach image behind it all.

props.synopsis: This jailed Sydney crime boss wears many hats, but billion-dollar Central American resort developer is not one of them.

title.children: Inside notorious Sydney gangster's resort empire attempt in Belize

image.altText: AFL players trying the Centra Bounce

props.synopsis: In a second during a warm-up, AFLW rookie Ash Centra's slick ball-handling kicks off a tricky trend across the sport.

title.children: AFL stars tying themselves in knots to emulate 19yo's trademark move

image.altText: A woman holds balls of rice to the camera.

props.synopsis: Amid severe shortages and pressure from Donald Trump's "reciprocal tariffs", Japan is under unprecedented pressure to eat more foreign rice. Here's why that's controversial.

title.children: Japan's rice crisis sparks debate over food security and identity

image.altText: A graphic of a house being dropped on a conveyor belt.

props.synopsis: From early colonial settlers to the post-war construction boom, prefabricated and modular housing has a long history in Australia. Can factory-built homes fix our housing woes and help the climate?

title.children: Modular homes can be built quickly and cheaply. But there's an image problem

image.altText: A man looks dejected after losing an NRL match

props.synopsis: After a performance coach Anthony Seibold labelled as the club's "worst in a long time" Manly captain Daly Cherry-Evans has come to grips with his time at the club beginning to approach it's end.

title.children: Reality hitting Cherry-Evans as Manly's finals hopes fade out

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Ah, back again I see. I do admire your courage for giving it another go … just kidding, I never feel that way.

title.children: Put your trivia know-how to the test. I dare you

image.altText: A Bushmaster sporting Ukrainian flags stands in front of a Globemaster airplane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: A senior US senator says the Albanese government deserves more credit for its level of defence spending but should still go further.

title.children: US senator says Australia spending more on defence than given credit for

image.altText: A teenage girl holds a football and wears a green and gold jersey, leaning against a goal.

props.synopsis: Ruby Miller will represent Australia at the upcoming Deaflympics, but unlike other athletes who represent Australia, she is paying her way.

title.children: Teen must pay her own way to play in national women's deaf soccer team

image.altText: A man sits on a pile of tyres.

props.synopsis: Two Darwin businesses have been left with tonnes of tyres and a massive clean-up bill after falling victim to a tyre dumping scheme that has impacted people across Australia.

title.children: The 'nightmare' scam that illegally dumped 50 tonnes of old tyres in a yard

image.altText: an aerial view of Sydney Football Stadium

props.synopsis: Sydney Football Stadium at Moore Park will shut for 10-weeks to undergo fixes to its drainage, which has for months been impacting the playing field.

title.children: Sydney stadium to shut for fixes at no cost to taxpayers, premier says

image.altText: A man in a dark suit and checkered tie speaks to reporters

props.synopsis: WA Labor are accusing the state opposition leader of mixed messaging over WA's revamped firearms legislation, following fallout from a failed disallowance motion this week.

title.children: Basil Zempilas labelled 'coward' in social media swipe over gun laws messaging

image.altText: A man with grey hair speaking

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Labor-leader-turned-independent MP David O'Byrne will offer confidence and supply to the Rockliff government in a move that could help the Liberal party maintain its hold on power.

title.children: 'It's not been an easy decision': Key independent David O'Byrne delivers support to Liberals

image.altText: An Indian man wearing a green shirt with his left arm in a sling, sitting on a grey couch.

props.synopsis: Saurabh Anand feared he may have to leave Australia after a shocking machete attack saw him nearly lose his hand. However, the government has granted him a visa on compassionate grounds.

title.children: Victim of 'cowardly' alleged attack granted fresh Australian visa

image.altText: A young woman wearing an ankle-length skirt and blouse roller skating in the middle of a city street.

props.synopsis: In 1977, the ABC interviewed a 21-year-old rollerskater during a police crackdown on public nuisance, in a video that has since gone viral. Five decades later, we've tracked her down — and she still skates.

title.children: Melbourne rollerskating icon famous again — half a century later
